title: Judge skewers $1.5 billion Anthropic settlement with authors in pirated books case over AI training
description: A federal judge on Monday skewered a $1.5 billion settlement between artificial intelligence company Anthropic and authors who allege nearly half million books had been illegally pirated to train chatbots, raising the specter that the case could still end up going to trial.
content: A federal judge on Monday skewered a $1.5 billion settlement between artificial intelligence company Anthropic and authors who allege nearly half million books had been illegally pirated to train chatbots, raising the specter that the case could stil... [2968 chars]

title: Ladakh LG constitutes committee to explore AI-driven good governance
description: Excelsior Correspondent LEH, Sept 8: The Lieutenant Governor of Ladakh today accorded sanction for the constitution of a high-level committee to explore the potential implementation of Artificial Intelligence (AI)-driven technologies aimed at strengthening good governance in the Union Territory. The committee will be chaired by Sanjeev Khirwar, Principal Secretary and will include Dr Laltinkhuma Franklin, Secretary Finance & Director Accounts & Treasuries, Sanjit Rodrigues, Administrative Secretary, Bhupesh Chaudhary, Administrative Secretary and Rudra Goud P T, Administrative Secretary as members. Shashanka […]

title: Trying To Limit What Artificial General Intelligence Will Know Is A Lot Harder Than It Might Seem
description: Can we limit what AI knows so that AI won't help evildoers such as devising bioweapons? It's not as easy as it seems. Here is the AI insider scoop on practicalities.
content: In today’s column, I examine a common assumption that after we advance AI to become artificial general intelligence (AGI) we can limit the said-to-be knowledge of AGI, doing so to avoid having AGI do untoward acts. An example would be to omit bioweap... [11075 chars]

title: Press freedom is crucial, and journalism must remain human
description: AHEAD of her first TUC Congress as general secretary of the National Union of Journalists, Laura Davison spoke to the Morning Star about the urgent challenges facing members —  the rise of artificial intelligence, the deadly risks faced by reporters in Gaza, and threats to press freedom at home.“The future of the media and journalism and how it is sustained is absolutely crucial,” she said. “[Journalism] is essential to the …  democratic principles of the country.

title: AI Chatbots Are ‘Clear Danger’ to Kids, Australian Watchdog Says
description: Artificial intelligence-powered chatbots that encourage suicide or hold sexually explicit conversations pose a “clear and present danger” to children, Australia’s online safety regulator said, as it rolled out new rules governing the services.
content:
Artificial intelligence-powered chatbots that encourage suicide or hold sexually explicit conversations pose a “clear and present danger” to children, Australia’s online safety regulator said, as it rolled out new rules governing the services.

title: AI accounting for just 1% of all job losses around the world
description: Artificial intelligence (AI) accounts for just 1% of job losses worldwide at present, with minimal overall impact expected by 2028, according to global tech research firm Gartner Inc.
content:
Artificial intelligence (AI) accounts for just 1% of job losses worldwide at present, with minimal overall impact expected by 2028, according to global tech research firm Gartner Inc.
